title: Bug 49299 - Incorrect behavior with custom cookie name affecting URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that when a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same name should be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL. The actual behavior observed is that the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' but the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead of the custom name.
EB: The web application should use the custom name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' as the name of the URI parameter for session id encoding in the URL when URL rewriting is enabled.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Enable URL rewriting in the web application.
2. Configure a custom name for the session tracking cookies.
3. Access the web application and navigate to a page.
4. Observe the cookie name sent by the page and the name used in the Reload link URL.
